Tweet text: "Why we won’t just leave: what #Alaska is telling the world about #ClimateChange" is a free virtual #art #exhibit till April 10. The walkthrough features paintings, photography, stories, & video profiles of over 15 artists, scientists, writers & activists. https://t.co/QHoXOWvET9 https://t.co/HEDpyPxYhf
We've submitted our abstract - you should too! #conference #PolarResearch #ECRs https://t.co/eFC17SGe6t

What exciting new projects were funded under the Navigating the New Arctic #NNA program from @NSF in 2020? Check out the list with quick descriptions from @ArcticResearch here: https://t.co/fsulYJPAKh https://t.co/Ks6CqwIfjR
Thanks to all the presenters for an amazing virtual conference! Can't wait to be in person again. #ArcticResearch #ASSW2021 #SharingScience https://t.co/oPxZpL7wZg
Our pleasure, Hannah! Check out her dataset "#Arctic Ocean #freshwater storage and fluxes from CMIP6 model ensembles 1950-2100" here: https://t.co/grtpAvlpg8 https://t.co/cCU7fdRgZn

An insightful comment from Roberta Glenn discussing her experience & how it impacts her research: "I've seen eyes gloss over in my community once scientists start speaking...it's important to make research findings meaningful for the people you're doing the work for."

Bonus: Hajo Eicken discussing his poster, a review of 124 observing activities from global literature to see how the #Arctic compares to non-Arctic regions & 30 surveys from Arctic community monitoring programs. Will be released as a special report in BioScience in May! https://t.co/zUejlAT7zo
She continues with some of the observations community members are reporting about #SeaIce: https://t.co/xM23I25fyP

She's working with https://t.co/SOD0aRrYAI - a platform for sharing near daily sea ice data and observations, and how those observations are impacting #Arctic residents. Recent concerns from communities: erosion, warmer and windier conditions, lack of snow, etc.

Next: Roberta Glenn documenting #environmental change in #Alaska using #CommunityBased observations that have accessible #data (meaning able to get and able to be UNDERSTOOD by anyone) that addresses the needs of the community. https://t.co/kl1Emw4cml

Who are these pilots of the unmanned aircraft? Local community members, trained remotely due to COVID-19. Plus, these pilots are being paid through the village, and will have the skills to be paid as contractors well past the life of the project. #ASSW2021

@FairbanksJIG: in #Alaska, we need to inspect diesel storage tanks...many are off roads & it's hard to get boots on the ground to inspect them. Plus, communities need info for emergency response. Solution to both? Unmanned aircraft to inform decision making locally & regionally. https://t.co/RbljDJJIId
She continues: "People and nature, natural science and social science...these are not separate groups, they must be intermixed."

Lisbeth Iverson speaking about community-driven approaches for #sustainable urban development in the #Arctic & emphasizing the importance of #DataSharing, the balance of sharing appropriately, and always following the @GidaGlobal CARE principles. https://t.co/sPH35kEkGE

@Marianne_Fa: speaking about #fisheries research on #Arctic char using a community-driven approach - both biophysical methods & interviews with #Inuit fishers. Interweaving different ways of knowing to understand the complex interactions of #climate & fish. https://t.co/vHQT6rILlr
Hopping in slightly late to "Use and Usability of #Data and Information within #Arctic Community-Driven Research" - looking forward to this session! #ASSW2021

Also worth noting is that the initial #FAIR scores, especially in the #interoperable & #reusable categories, has increased over time - indicating researchers are getting more FAIR in their initial submissions, which is likely due to better training and better tools. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/6HkuOOLC24

@BeltzEcology using @arcticdatactr's corpus to see how curation improves how "FAIR" metadata is. Metadata gets a quantifiable FAIR score upon submission & then after the curation team helps the researcher make the #metadata more complete; #curation helps the FAIR score increase. https://t.co/PrQUBgkDd5

Brainstorming solutions to these challenges was also a part of the workshop - communication, policy change, and funding are all mentioned as ways to motivate progress. #ASSW2021 #DataManagement https://t.co/BBTMd2TJKy

Back to the oral talks: Nick Brown speaking about challenges to interoperable permafrost data management identified on a @PermafrostNet workshop - most of these challenges are universal, not just for #permafrost #data, and will require change across data communities. https://t.co/VckRtQ4GwA

Next - @twilamoon speaking about #QGreenland! https://t.co/bRKcsnuvRD for the GIS #OpenSource information, and https://t.co/dqX4sZWYZj for related #Greenland datasets. No #GIS experience necessary to explore. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/qM5AKaWi3k

Thibaud Dezutter - Amundsen Science at https://t.co/yjdfeV7mdt - presenting his poster of 20 years of mooring data accessible through the ArcticNet program. #OpenAccess #ASSW2021 https://t.co/y06KnrvgYq

"Visualization makes data accessible and explorable by users" - Birgit Heim, presenting her poster with Arctic datasets & maps from https://t.co/opd56tOQTd a site that lists scientifically prepared data from @AWI_Media research via WebGIS projects. https://t.co/f8UraCXuf7

Next: a poster from Vitalii Zemlainskii speaking about his poster on the Russian Arctic vegetation archive which assembles #circumpolar plot #data into a publicly accessible web-based archive. https://t.co/Ag6sGZmVnN https://t.co/MGrylKMNz5

The CCADI #infrastructure brings together #data stewards into a graph #database with a #metadata aggregator & #semantics AND will enable data object sharing - appropriate for physical & social sciences as well as #Indigenous knowledge. More on CCADI: https://t.co/Aw6jpJKpIs https://t.co/dcWioAhPxO

Next: Peter Pulsifer speaking about the effort to build a global #interoperable #data infrastructure for the #Arctic community, which includes #Indigenous knowledge and information systems. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/AfZoG4YjAU

First: Julia Boike on a simple, standardized protocol for data collection on permafrost thaw; all you need is a ruler & a mobile phone (w/ the myThaw app, in development) to measure #permafrost! Goal is to get everyone involved & the data will be available. #CitizenScience https://t.co/n1ldAyoJs8

Excited for part 2 of Progress Towards Realizing Data Sharing for the Arctic Region! This session will feature a presentation by our Data Fellow @BeltzEcology: Analysis of @arcticdatactr #Metadata using FAIR principles shows increased quality across multiple metrics. #ASSW2021

Claire Herbert from the Canadian Consortium for Arctic Data Interoperability discussing CCADI's ocean acidification work - they've created #reproducible scripts for processing #interdisciplinary rosette CTD data, with #semantics, for users to access later thru the data portal. https://t.co/gLm4FQRR4F

@etiennegodin: Arctic is a #data desert w/ few weather stations. MODAAT (Merged Observatory Data for Arctic Air #Temperature) will fix that as a #repository of temp data from the circumpolar Arctic; they've invited weather station operators to contribute data to make that happen. https://t.co/Z6ftEOtyP7

@Cryosensing discussing COVID19's effects on field research in #Svalbard - @SIOS_KC helped scientists unable to get to the #Arctic patch "#data gaps" w/ #RemoteSensing & with a Logistics Sharing Board so that researchers/SIOS folks who could travel could help get data for others. https://t.co/2BcGAi3l8Z

Next: @SBH_EcoData speaking about  @EMERGE_BII (Emergent Ecosystem Response to Change), a project facing a common challenge: managing #heterogenous data. To that end, they're developing a #graph #database for storage, sharing, integration, & querying like https://t.co/TU7bMBIPnF. https://t.co/kFnAxzr6YS

The next talk: Lomonosov Moscow State University Marine Research Center (LMSU MRC) is a company that focuses on environmental surveys of #Arctic seas and coastal areas - they presented on an interoperable geoportal with #datasets collected from the Arctic. https://t.co/lMyt8JuhGd https://t.co/XWzgAIYDx6

A great question from Zdenka Sokolíčková: Anyone have experience with systems for sharing data that can build a bridge between #NaturalScience data and #SocialScience data? SIOS focused on Earth science, but we're expecting this topic to come up again in this series of talks.

#Svalbard Integrated Arctic Earth Observing System (@SIOS_KC) speaking about how they're cooperating with several different repositories to create a single access point, harvesting & displaying distributed #Arctic #data all in one place! #ASSW2021 https://t.co/imS9BpUMHt
Another early morning in PST...but so worth it for the start of Progress Towards Realizing #Data Sharing for the #Arctic Region and Beyond, session 1 of 2! #ASSW2021
@VicBuschman - "there's a narrative on what Indigenous communities are capable of, but we are a very capable and knowledgeable group of people and can do the research given the tools and training."

Katherine Wilson sharing her experience on how she was able to help support #Inuit self-determination in research - her role was as a mentor to train Inuit youth to do the research themselves, rather than have her (as a non-Indigenous person) do that work. https://t.co/8LyM4hO4Yf

@Msheremata: #Indigenous-driven solutions involve a lot of people behind the scenes...working beyond the boundaries of established norms in research. Working with the @ArcticEider Society has opened her eyes on how research can change. https://t.co/RgdrmxdFuI
Lucassie Arragutainaq: We [Indigenous peoples] know what's happening, but #researchers and their work can help to tell us why. #ASSW2021

Now up: a demonstration video of a new app - The Indigenous Knowledge Social Network! @SIKUApp's goal is to facilitate self-determination in #research, #education and #stewardship for #Indigenous communities. More info: https://t.co/4vEegzDLvD #ASSW2021

@KseStanislav: #Decolonization of research is necessary, and following #Indigenous #methodologies ensure that Indigenous issues can be addressed and solutions carried out in a more respectful and ethical way. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/XNbSWx6iTZ

She continues with an insightful venn diagram about the conflict in values between science & Iñupiat Ilitqusiat - but that there is an ethical space in the middle with shared goals & equity. The community needs decision making power, with tangible benefits back to the community. https://t.co/fZxhrPGeUz

@MargaretAnamaq describing co-production of knowledge as intentional - a blend of the scientific method and traditional Indigenous knowledge. Having diversity of perspectives is a way towards problem solving. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/aG9i7zRkh5

"Indigenous #conservation and #management practices are not written into law, but are part of the #culture and way of life. If we want to call the body of the Indigenous way of being, there is a term for that: OECM - Other Effective Conservation Methods." https://t.co/yaFLxV8UBH

@VicBuschman: conservation still has a colonial context. To that end, she is leading the first all-Indigenous team to look at #conservation from a #circumpolar point of view & how #Indigenous communities are already engaged in conservation & sustainability efforts. https://t.co/KuKSoR3ckG

@carolinabehe describing the #Inuit view of the #ecosystem as a puzzle - the pieces are continuously adjusting and all work together. Indigenous knowledge guides people to focus on the links between rather than individual pieces. Food security = a healthy ecosystem. https://t.co/QTwNtZaWtf
Next up - a thread of takeaways from Learning from #Indigenous Methodologies in Collaborative #Arctic Science! A pre-emptive thank you to all the presenters sharing their experiences. #ASSW2021

On how researchers should interact with #Indigenous communities: "Build a partnership of trust and take the lead of the community...they will guide you on what is important to them, what their priorities are." #ASSW2021

"Our own hunters & elders are scientists in their own right...western scientists need to have an open mind to learn what they don't know. Go into communities with a great deal of humility...#Indigenous peoples are amazing teachers to what #sustainability can look like." #ASSW2021

"Why are we lacking in movement on #ClimateChange? We're lacking a sense of imagination...we need to imagine a new way forward. We need to realign our economic values with the way #Indigenous peoples see the world - sustainable, no waste, mindful attention to the land." #ASSW2021

"Human trauma and planet trauma are one. A child without coping mechanisms will act out; the planet is acting out with severe weather events....Things will happen [to change that trauma] at the speed of #empathy and the speed of #trust." #ASSW2021

Reminding us of a talk she gave 10 years ago: "Our home [the #Arctic] is a barometer for other regions of the world - if we can not save the frozen Arctic, how can we save the forests, the oceans?" We're still up against this very same problem.
"It isn't just the #ice we'd be losing...we'd be losing the wisdom, the connection to the land, the connection to the ancestors." #ASSW2021

Tuning in to the #keynote of #ASSW2021 and listening to Sheila Watt-Cloutier speak about Humanizing Climate Change. One remark stood out so far: people know the wildlife of the #Arctic more than its people.

Gertrude Saxinger wrapping up with mission statements from this workshop. Overall, a fantastic 3 hours spent with everyone discussing these key issues of co-production, rightsholders, and research interaction. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/BQvPq409Xt

A new point not said yet in this workshop from Anna-Maria Stan - finding new ideas is not possible if everyone thinks the same way. #Diverse backgrounds are necessary for truly innovative thinking & solutions in the pursuit of co-creation of knowledge. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/deompogKXN
(Link to the full paper from @EUPolarNet: https://t.co/yXs7IxCp9x)

Annette Scheepstra discussing a white paper that produced recommendations for #transdisciplinary research and co-production of knowledge, hitting a lot of key points already discussed (communication, dissemination, etc): #ASSW2021 https://t.co/vwUbzeghLv
@hugueslantuit now telling the group about Facebook Messenger as an essential line of communication for #Arctic communities. It's one way for researchers to gain a relationship of trust. #ASSW2021
Tips from @askjervedal to go beyond the common obstacles towards meaning engagement and co-creation: all focus on communication. #ASSW2021 #CoProduction https://t.co/ZC9wVJm2T7

Now speaking: Stanislav Ksenofontov @KseStanislav saying one of the major challenges in co-creation of knowledge is dissemination of results back to communities - researchers just aren't doing that important piece of the work.
She continues: the #science community together with funders and decision makers should become EQUAL partners with #Indigenous communities. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/REM5PzC1jE
Zoia Vylka Ravna defining some potential goals to improve co-creation of knowledge in #Arctic research based on genuine community involvement and participation: https://t.co/jLdx6DVjYL

Next up: @RLaptander speaking about challenges in her anthropology research - privacy of collected #data, permissions for using interviews and other data, compensation for working hours, insider vs outsider feelings. https://t.co/elEAdApUnf
Britt @Kramvig: take the opportunity to genuinely get to know #Indigenous students and scholars and be able to provide a safe space when they need it. #ASSW2021

#Training #Opportunity! @UW's eScience Institute and @NASA SnowEx are hosting five days of tutorials, data exploration, software development, and community building focused on #OpenSource tools to analyze and visualize SnowEx data. Apply here by Apr 9: https://t.co/Y7xlewhyX4 https://t.co/8GeisFzB3D

On their leadership team they have 4 #AlaskaNative scholars, and 3 out of 4 of them have completed PhDs during the process (capacity building). This is the first group (in the US) that has an entirely #Indigenous Executive Advisory Committee. #ASSW2021

What can co-created research look like in a meaningful way? @evonpeter answers that question in one way by showing the example of the Alaska Native Collaborative Hub for Research on Resilience. https://t.co/uSjmtniFZ9

Next up: @evonpeter (Gwich'in heritage). Currently showing an Indigenous bone diagram as just one illustration of the sophistication of #Indigenous knowledge, and all of these names have stories about how those bones came to be named as such. https://t.co/abjVJKSXkF
Oskal continues: Neither traditional #Indigenous knowledge nor scientific knowledge contains all the information we need - we need to include both ways of knowing. #ASSW2021

Anders Oskal (Saami heritage) discussing the preference for the term "rightsholders" vs "stakeholders" - stakeholders as a term is intermixed with "shareholders" and capitalistic development. #ASSW2021
Hopping into Co-Creating #Arctic Research Together with #Indigenous Peoples at #ASSW2021 - so looking forward to this workshop! https://t.co/Citn8hhzfG
Absolutely love that this presentation started with responsible principles for conducting #research in the #Arctic with their Yup'ik translations. https://t.co/Z3x69i4jd8
Next up on the Arctic Science Summit Week docket - the @IARPCCollab community meeting on the development of the #Arctic Research Plan 2022-2026! #ASSW2021 https://t.co/HA6kiLYABx
Most importantly: access the #DataPortal here! https://t.co/ogpO2Gwhw7 #ArcticData @INTERACT66 #ASSW2021 https://t.co/YOTUYjU2pi

Now speaking: Hannele Savela on the concept behind the @INTERACT66 #DataPortal. Heavily influenced by the @FAIRsharing_org principles, #MachineLearning algorithms, and #metadata harvesting rather than hosting data. #ASSW2021 https://t.co/712bnHiOSs
"Your primary scientific legacy will be through the data you generate." Powerful words! #ASSW2021 #DataSharing

"One of the major bottlenecks we see to integration with open data is cultural - research communities can be conservative with data sharing." #Interoperability with #semantics and #metadata granularity were also mentioned but that cultural problem is harder to solve.

øystein Godøy speaking now and reminding us of the importance of #DataManagement: many #data are not available for reuse after publication. Goal is to make @INTERACT66 data visible through integration with other #repositories. https://t.co/qQb5MiyUrn

We're up VERY EARLY in Pacific time to watch the #ASSW2021 session about @INTERACT66 new #OpenAccess #DataPortal that provides free and open access to data from the INTERACT partner organizations and research stations! Watch the promo video here: https://t.co/3qabXlXf3t

Call for #abstracts! The 50th International #Arctic Workshop is #virtual this year and inviting folks to present their recently completed or in progress work. Registration is very low cost! Abstracts due April 1. More info: https://t.co/u1WiXXg0JQ #SharingSciFri #conferences2021 https://t.co/U3GG51ekMZ

If you missed our last quarterly #newsletter in your inbox, no fear - check it out on our blog! Reply to this Tweet or DM us with your email if you're not getting the newsletter and would like to be added. #Arctica https://t.co/Q2HCjwsHrZ https://t.co/MzteAKkM55

It's your #Lucky day: now you can explore Alaska Native cultures, museum objects, community videos, & classroom lessons from your desk, wherever that is! The Smithsonian Arctic Studies Center has a variety of resources at their Learning Lab. Check it out! https://t.co/ufL3lhqiUe https://t.co/qSLZ0G7Ist
@IARPCCollab @ArcticResearch We'll be there!

Exciting #TechTuesday news - downloads of ICESat-2 data have passed the 10 million mark as of 12 January! If you haven't been one of those 10 million, check out the data from @NSIDC here: https://t.co/JdiJ9i4nne https://t.co/qtbbv1v0mx

@NSF recently funded 17 projects totaling $26.7 million, which will support 69 investigators across 21 institutions + funding students & postdocs. Awardees, congratulations & we can't wait to receive your data! Contact us for help with your #data. https://t.co/tOewWsi1Zo https://t.co/a8jLMeoYGN

Attending #ASSW2021? This looks like an excellent #workshop: Co-creating #Arctic Research Together with #Indigenous Rightsholders. Open session, so anyone can join! More info: https://t.co/8PKJaRi57s https://t.co/1lcBz853V5
So proud of all these projects!! Spend your Monday morning catching up with them if you haven't seem them already. #HacktheArctic https://t.co/fc9IeoB96s

#funding opportunity for #FundingFriday! @NSF is looking for proposals to initiate industry & university cooperative research centers to address issues in the #Arctic that have broad interest from industry and governmental partners. For more info: https://t.co/pZF1LJNnaM https://t.co/l24kSXBGby
Definitely worth looking and commenting on! https://t.co/iYUKHtp773
All are welcome! #Indigenous #Data #Sovereignty is a key issue for many, especially those working in the #Arctic. https://t.co/Xz9sSSAqd7

#uhoh: The UV Index was more than 6 standard deviations ABOVE normal earlier this year due to exceptionally large ozone depletion. Read more here https://t.co/mLn4uYKTKL & check out more #Arctic #UV data from Dr. Bernhard here: https://t.co/rkovp2kwWE #WarmingWednesday https://t.co/BiFL9uA7hO

#GoodNewsTues for #food of the future - researchers have cultured #Arctic sea lettuce over 10 months and found that they grew consistently high quality food with high nutritional value, comparable to fruits, nuts, and grains! https://t.co/DHIfO5fCHI #seaweed #SustainableLiving https://t.co/QklHuDJA66

@mcgillu is hosting a #roundtable on #Inuit Qaujimajatuqangit Traditional Knowledge in the Contemporary World on 19 March w/ talks on innovative applications of #TraditionalKnowledge as a central aspect of #decolonialization & our common future. Register: https://t.co/Jqmu6EQoI3 https://t.co/86FiQle6jE
Excited to participate in #HacktheArctic as mentors! https://t.co/Ru5olGmm61

#Registration now open for #Arctic Science Summit Week! #ASSW2021 is virtual this year - participate in sessions on the changing Arctic, Living in the Arctic, Education & Capacity Building, and more! More info: https://t.co/cx5yKjKsSh #SharingSciFri #Conferences https://t.co/u1UFwSvYdz

It's wonderful to have the option to watch talks pre-recorded, but it's tough to network with these virtual events. Hopefully a hybrid approach moving forward will take the best of both worlds! https://t.co/A9a697JBn6
@BeltzEcology somewhere we have @arcticdatactr hex stickers...looking good! :)

#WorkshopWednesday: Arctic Research Collaboration Workshop from @ArcticResearch. Join a panel of transdisciplinary researchers to share examples of successful #collaborative #research projects. Apply to participate in discussion & hands-on work by 17 Mar! https://t.co/PGuu5xN3k0 https://t.co/oiEcuueBwj
A great #Workshop for #WorkshopWednesday! Apply by Monday the 8th to participate. https://t.co/n72UfAumhv

Attending a neat talk from @BUPardeeSchool in 40 minutes discussing Mediated Arctic Geographies - a research project that studies the poetics & #politics of #Arctic #geography in contemporary fiction & #art. You're invited too! https://t.co/P0EirqrMK3 https://t.co/hmJw3vj8Yy
#TechTuesday: #ICYMI all of the talks from @rstudio::global are available to watch! https://t.co/YGf2GqRlml #OpenAccess #RStats @rOpenSci https://t.co/Z7TyZOgqYL
@PeterSUngar Hadn't seen that one! Congrats! :)
